text: in New York and other cities across the
country protesters voice their
frustrations Sunday about the verdict
and the murder trial of George Zimmerman
he is guilty of killing a young man for
no reason and so it's really hard to
hear that someone has said that he is
not guilty of that a year and a half ago
mr. Zimmerman had fatally shot an
unarmed teenager named Trayvon Martin
igniting a racially polarizing debate
across the United States amid calls for
calm including from President Obama the
demonstrations over the past 24 hours
were emotional but most passed without
major altercations at the end of the
trial mr. Zimmerman's defense team said
the jury's decision was justified
obviously we are ecstatic with the
results George Zimmerman was never
guilty of anything except protecting
himself in self-defense I'm glad that
the jury saw it that way and I hope that
everyone who thinks particularly those
who doubted George's reasons and doubted
his background now understand that the
jury knew everything that they knew was
enough of them to find him not guilty
meanwhile civil rights leaders suggest
that further illegal steps could be
taken and the victim's family expressed
their feelings following a church
service on Sunday morning I am very
disappointed by the verdict are they
saying that Zimmerman was not guilty was
guilty of murdering an unarmed boy going
home alone attending to his business
clearly their grounds for civil rights
charges here the verdict a man that does
not exhaust the legal options of this
family
and the bigger community issues of civil
rights we now have a state a position on
the books in the state of Florida where
an unarmed teenager who committed no
crime can be killed and the killer can
face
of difference we're very concerned and
very hurt and very disappointed at this
point but we know in the end God will
prevail and he will justice will be
served and we'll just keep everybody in
their prayers
